SENT.plain: The frequency of mastoiditis and its complications have declined since the advent of antibiotics
Among all complications, transverse sinus thrombosis is the least frequent, although it may have the highest mortality rate
Before the introduction of surgery and antibiotic treatment, mortality was close to 100%
Previous administration of antibiotics may lead to changes in the clinical presentation of venous sinus thrombosis that make diagnosis more difficult, in spite of greatly improved imaging methods

This article reports 4 confirmed cases of venous sinus thrombosis complicating mastoiditis that were diagnosed and treated at Nossa Senhora das Gra√ßas Hospital, Curitiba--PR from June, 1999, to February, 2000
All 4 cases were documented by magnetic resonance imaging
Each patient recovered after treatment with antibiotics and anticoagulation
Diagnosis of the complication requires a high level of clinical suspicion and then evaluation by mastoid CT and cranial MRI
